page.title: 05ROSEACRE
page.content: This village has seen a small amount of development in the last ten to twelve years, during which time houses have been built. Though different in design to the old handmade brick and slate roof cottages, the new dormer types with faced brick work, painted white and steeply pitched tiled roofs complement the village scene. The old farm houses, one of which is called Roseacre Hall Farm, are very large in proportion with ample room for families. They are very high too which presents problems with heating. The cellars are still used in some farmhouses to keep foodstuffs cool. Pleasing features of the old houses are the hand made bricks, which were made locally, and the stone lintels. Sash and cord windows are a feature of this type of house.
